data.title: Fight or Flight
data.statement:
You are developing an AI bot to assist you in a role-playing-game. Your AI encounters a monster in the forest and has to choose whether to fight or flee. 

If the AI bot can defeat the monster without losing all health points write {{Fight}}. Otherwise write {{Flight}}. Both will attack each other at the same time. It is possible for both the Monster and your AI to lose all their health points during the same turn.

The second output line will be an integer stating how much health the AI would have left after a battle (output required for both flight and fight scenarios).

Element rules:

There are three element type: {{ice}}, {{fire}} and {{water}}.

If {{fire}} is against {{ice}}, the base damage of the {{fire}} player is doubled. 

{{Water}} does twice the usual base damage against {{fire}}. {{Ice}} does twice the usual base damage against {{water}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are developing an AI bot to assist you in a role-playing-game. Your AI encounters a monster in the forest and has to choose whether to fight or flee.

If the AI bot can defeat the monster without losing all health points write Fight. Otherwise write Flight. Both will attack each other at the same time. It is possible for both the Monster and your AI to lose all their health points during the same turn.

The second output line will be an integer stating how much health the AI would have left after a battle (output required for both flight and fight scenarios).

Element rules:

There are three element type: ice, fire and water.

If fire is against ice, the base damage of the fire player is doubled.

Water does twice the usual base damage against fire. Ice does twice the usual base damage against water.
Input
Line 1: An integer monsterHealth for the monster's starting health.
Line 2: An integer monsterAttack for the monster's base damage amount.
Line 3: A string monsterElement stating the monster's element
Line 4: An integer aiHealth for the AI's starting health.
Line 5: An integer aiAttack for the AI's base damage amount.
Line 6: A string aiElement stating the AI's element.
Output
Line 1: Write either Fight or Flight.
Line 2: An integer stating the health points the AI would have remaining after the battle (for both fight and flight). It can be negative.
Constraints
0 < monsterHealth ≤ 100
0 < monsterAttack ≤ 100
0 < aiHealth ≤100
0 < aiAttack ≤ 100
Example
Input
10
10
water
100
100
ice
Output
Fight
90
